core.templatetags package¶

Submodules¶

core.templatetags.core_filters module¶

class core.templatetags.core_filters.Counter(value)¶

Bases: object

Very simple counter used in the counter tag

increment()¶

Use this to increment the counter. Please note that you should use {{ c.incement }}, not {% c.increment %}, as this is not a tag method :return: Empty string

class core.templatetags.core_filters.SetVarNode(var_name, var_value)¶

Bases: django.template.base.Node

This is a very simple node that just assigns a given value to a given variable in the template context

render(context)¶

Return the node rendered as a string.

core.templatetags.core_filters.counter(parser, token)¶

Creates a counter object under a specified variable name, optionally with a starting number. By default it starts counting at 0.

Usage: {% counter VAR_NAME %} or {% counter VAR_NAME STARTING_VALUE %} (to specify the starting value, must be an int or int in a string)

To increment: {{ VAR_NAME.increment }}

To display the value: {{ VAR_NAME }}

core.templatetags.core_filters.in_commission(current_user)¶

Check whether the current user is in the ‘Commissie’ or ‘Secretaris’ group

core.templatetags.core_filters.is_secretary(current_user)¶

Check whether the current user is in the ‘Secretary’ group

core.templatetags.core_filters.set_var(parser, token)¶

{% set some_var = ‘123’ %}
